User Audit

The User Audit section records changes made inside Unit Master so that administrators can see who did what and when, for better control and accountability.

What is User Audit?

The User Audit page provides a detailed history of actions performed by users inside Unit Master. It is used to trace important changes such as updates, approvals and deletions.

This audit trail is essential for accountability, compliance and internal control, especially in financial and regulated environments.

View User Audit

The User Audit tracks actions performed inside the system. It helps answer questions such as:

  • Who changed a record?
  • What was updated, created or deleted?
  • When did the change happen?

By reviewing the audit log, administrators and auditors can verify that users are following procedures and can investigate any unusual or unauthorised changes.
